member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getCurrent
member.summary: Returns the current GUI instance.
member.returns: Current GUI instance.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getChild(int) const
member.summary: Returns a child widget with a given number.
member.param: Child widget number.
member.returns: Child widget.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.isChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget}) const
member.summary: Checks if a given widget belongs to the GUI.
member.param: Widget to check.
member.returns: true if the widget belongs to the GUI; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.setFocusedPermanent(bool)
member.summary: Changes the permanent color of the focused widget.
member.param: 1 - a font color is overridden with the global GUI focused color; 0 - a font color is unchanged.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.isFocusedPermanent const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the permanent color of the focused widget is changed.
member.returns: 1 if the font color is overridden with the global GUI focused color; 0 if the font color is unchanged.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getKeyActivity(unsignedint) const
member.summary: Checks if a given key already has a special purpose for the widget in focus.
member.param: One of the standard ASCII control codes or one of the KEY_* pre-defined variables.
member.returns: 1 if the key cannot be used; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.setResource(char)
member.summary: Changes the resource skin file used in the system GUI.
member.param: Path to the rc file.
member.returns: 1 if the resource file is successfully changed; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.setToolTip(int,int,char)
member.summary: Sets a tooltip.
member.param: X coordinate of the tooltip position.
Y coordinate of the tooltip position.
ToolTip text.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getToolTipHeight(char) const
member.summary: Returns a height of the given tooltip. Height of a single-line tooltip is equal to 21 pixels.
member.param: A tooltip text.
member.returns: Height of the given tooltip (in pixels).

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getToolTipWidth(char) const
member.summary: Returns the current width of the tooltip.
member.param: A tooltip text.
member.returns: Width of the tooltip.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.addChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget},int)
member.summary: Adds a given widget to the GUI.
member.param: Widget to add.
One of the ALIGN_* pre-defined variables. This is an optional parameter.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.addDictionary(char,char)
member.summary: Adds a new dictionary with localized interface strings. Dictionaries cannot be modified in run-time.
member.param: Path to the dictionary file.
Name of the dictionary language.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the dictionary is added successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.clearDictionaries
member.summary: Clears all dictionaries.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.clearTexture(char)
member.summary: Clears the specified GUI texture file cache.
member.param: Texture name.
member.returns: 1 if the texture is successfully cleared; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.create(char)
member.summary: GUI constructor.
member.param: GUI skin name.
member.returns: Pointer to the created GUI.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.destroy
member.summary: Destroys all GUI resources.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.disable
member.summary: Disables GUI rendering.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.enable
member.summary: Enables GUI rendering.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.hasTranslation(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if there is translation for a given string in the localization dictionary.
member.param: String to check.
member.returns: 1 if there is translation for the given string; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.parseColor(char) const
member.summary: Converts a color string in the Web format (RRGGBB / #RRGGBB or RRGGBBAA / #RRGGBBAA) into its vec4 equivalent.
member.param: Color string in the Web format.
member.returns: Color value as a vec4 vector (R, G, B, A).

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.removeChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget})
member.summary: Removes the specified widget from the GUI.
member.param: Child widget to be removed.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.removeFocus
member.summary: Removes focus from the GUI.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.replaceChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget},int)
member.summary: Replaces a given widget in the GUI with another widget.
member.param: Replacement widget.
Widget to be replaced.
One of the ALIGN_* pre-defined variables. This is an optional parameter.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.saveDictionary(char,char)
member.summary: Saves the current dictionary on disk. This function can be used to save the currently loaded dictionary into another file.
member.param: Name of the dictionary language.
Dictionary language name.
member.returns: 1 if the dictionary is saved successfully; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.translate(char)
member.summary: Returns the source string translated using the dictionary.
member.param: String to translate (source).
member.returns: Target (translated) string if it is found in the localization dictionary; otherwise, the source string.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.update
member.summary: Updates GUI.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.preRender
member.summary: Method executed after the update() and before the render() function. This method is used to make necessary preparations for rendering (e.g. prepare a texture) after the update() and is called automatically for WidgetSpriteViewport and WidgetSpriteNode to ensure proper rendering of the widgets during render(). In case you implement a custom GUI or widgets using the WidgetExtern class you should put all such rendering preparations to and call preRender() for GUI manually after update().

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.render
member.summary: Renders the GUI.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.render(int)
member.summary: Renders the GUI.
member.param: Pressed mouse button.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.updateHierarchy
member.summary: Updates the hierarchy for all widgets — the widgets are arranged, expanded to the required sizes and then their positions are updated. Updating the hierarchy may be required, for example, for getting the screen position immediately after the widget has been added to the hierarchy.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.isRenderingBootScreen
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the GUI currently renders the boot screen.
member.returns: true if the GUI currently renders the boot screen; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.isRenderingSplashScreen
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the GUI currently renders the splash screen.
member.returns: true if the GUI currently renders the splash screen; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.isRenderingLoadingScreen
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the GUI currently renders the loading screen.
member.returns: true if the GUI currently renders the loading screen; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.focusGained
member.summary: The focus is set on the GUI object.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.focusLost
member.summary: The focus is removed from the GUI.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.isHover(int,int) const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the cursor is hovering over the GUI object.
member.param: The X coordinate of the cursor in global coordinates.
The Y coordinate of the cursor in global coordinates.
member.returns: true if the cursor is hovering over the GUI object; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getWidgetIntersection(int,int)
member.summary: Returns the intersected widget that is visually perceptible (not empty, not transparent).
member.param: The X coordinate of the cursor in global coordinates.
The Y coordinate of the cursor in global coordinates.
member.returns: The intersected widget that is visually perceptible.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getUnderCursorWidget
member.summary: Returns the visually perceptible widget, over which the cursor is currently hovering.
member.returns: The widget, over which the cursor is currently hovering.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getFocusGui
member.summary: Returns the GUI object that is currently in focus.
member.returns: The GUI object currently in focus.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getGuiIntersection(int,int)
member.summary: Returns the intersected GUI object.This method takes Z-ordering into consideration: if the GUI object is overlapped by any other window, the method returns nullptr.
member.param: The X coordinate of the intersection point in global coordinates.
The Y coordinate of the intersection point in global coordinates.
member.returns: The intersected GUI object.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getUnderCursorGui
member.summary: Returns the GUI object that is currently under cursor.If case of dragging or resizing a window, this method returns nullptr. To receive the intersected GUI in such a case, use getGuiIntersection().
member.returns: GUI object currently under cursor.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getWorldGuiInstances(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Gui},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Returns all GUI instances that are available in the scene hierarchy and rendered as world objects.
member.param: All GUI instances that are available in the scene hierarchy and rendered as world objects.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getAndClearMouseWheel
member.summary: Returns the mouse scroll value and clears the mouse scroll state info.
member.returns: The mouse scroll value in the [-1;1] range.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.forceSetMouseWheel(int)
member.summary: Sets the mouse scroll value.
member.param: The mouse scroll value in the [-1;1] range.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getAndClearMouseWheelHorizontal
member.summary: Returns the mouse horizontal scroll value and clears the mouse scroll state info.
member.returns: The horizontal mouse scroll value in the [-1;1] range.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.forceSetMouseWheelHorizontal(int)
member.summary: Sets the mouse vertical scroll value.
member.param: The horizontal mouse scroll value in the [-1;1] range.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getKey(Input::KEY)
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the specified key is pressed.
member.param: One of the standard ASCII control codes or one of the KEY_* pre-defined variables.
member.returns: true if the key is pressed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getAndClearKey(Input::KEY)
member.summary: Returns the value indicating if the specified key is pressed and clears the key state info.
member.param: One of the standard ASCII control codes or one of the KEY_* pre-defined variables.
member.returns: true if the key is pressed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.toRenderSize(int) const
member.summary: Transforms the unit value to the pixel value.
member.param: Size in units.
member.returns: Size in pixels.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.toUnitSize(int) const
member.summary: Transforms the pixel value to the unit value.
member.param: Size in pixels.
member.returns: Size in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.setFontPath(char)
member.summary: Changes the regular font used in the system GUI.
member.param: Path to the font file.
member.returns: true if the font is set successfully, otherwise false.

member.summary: Returns the path to the regular font currently used in the system GUI.

member.summary: Changes the set of fonts — regular, bold, italic, and italic bold — used in the system GUI.
member.param: Path to the regular font file.
Path to the bold font file.
Path to the italic font file.
Path to the bold italic font file.
member.returns: true if the fonts are set successfully, otherwise false.

member.summary: Changes the bold font used in the system GUI.
member.param: Path to the bold font file.
member.returns: true if the fonts are set successfully, otherwise false.

member.summary: Returns the path to the bold font currently used in the system GUI.
member.returns: Path to the bold font file.

member.summary: Changes the italic font used in the system GUI.

member.returns: true if the font is set successfully, otherwise false.

member.summary: Returns the path to the italic font currently used in the system GUI.

member.summary: Changes the bold italic font used in the system GUI.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.setSkinPath(char)
member.summary: Changes the GUI skin used in the system GUI.

member.returns: true if the skin is set successfully, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.getSkinPath const
member.summary: Returns the path to the current GUI skin.

member.name: M:Unigine.Gui.get
member.summary: Returns the pointer to the current GUI.
member.returns: Pointer to GUI.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_CENTER
member.summary: Widget is centered relative to its container.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_LEFT
member.summary: Widget is aligned to the left side of its container.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_RIGHT
member.summary: Widget is aligned to the right side of its container.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_TOP
member.summary: Widget is aligned to the top of its container.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_BOTTOM
member.summary: Widget is aligned to the bottom of its container.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_EXPAND
member.summary: Widget occupies all available space inside its container.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_OVERLAP
member.summary: Widget is rendered over other widgets, on the foreground (or over the contents of the parent container). Overlapping widgets are sorted between each other (i.e. pop up when focused on). This flag also makes the window movable.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_BACKGROUND
member.summary: Widget is always placed under other widgets. If clicked on, it does not pop up. Use this flag together with ALIGN_OVERLAP one.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_FIXED
member.summary: Widget in focus stays on the background or on the foreground (depending on where it was created). This flag is valid only if GUI_ALIGN_OVERLAP is also set. Non-fixed overlapping windows can pop over the fixed ones, while the latter cannot do it.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ATTACH_LOG10
member.summary: Attached slider uses a logarithmic scale with the base ten.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ATTACH_MIN_EXPAND
member.summary: Minimum value of the attached slider can be lowered.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.ATTACH_MAX_EXPAND
member.summary: Maximum value of the attached slider can be raised.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_NONE
member.summary: No blending is used for a widget.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_ZERO
member.summary: Components of each widget color are multiplied by zero.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_ONE
member.summary: Components of each widget color are multiplied by one.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_SRC_COLOR
member.summary: Components of each widget color are multiplied by these factors (per component): (wR, wG, wB, wA) .

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR
member.summary: Components of each widget color are multiplied by these factors (per component): (1 - wR, 1 - wG, 1 - wB, 1 - wA) .

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_SRC_ALPHA
member.summary: Components of each widget color are multiplied by wA.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA
member.summary: Components of each widget color are multiplied by 1- wA.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_DEST_COLOR
member.summary: Components of each widget color are multiplied by these factors (per component): (bR, bG, bB, bA) .

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_DEST_COLOR
member.summary: Components of each widget color are multiplied by these factors (per component): (1 - bR, 1 - bG, 1 - bB, 1 - bA) .

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_DEST_ALPHA
member.summary: Components of each widget color are multiplied by bA.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_DEST_ALPHA
member.summary: Components of each widget color are multiplied by 1- bA.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BUFFER_ALL
member.summary: Mask that specifies all channels.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BUFFER_RED
member.summary: Mask that specifies the red channel.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BUFFER_GREEN
member.summary: Mask that specifies the green channel.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BUFFER_BLUE
member.summary: Mask that specifies the blue channel.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.BUFFER_ALPHA
member.summary: Mask that specifies the alpha channel.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.CURSOR_NONE
member.summary: Mouse pointer is not displayed.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.CURSOR_ARROW
member.summary: Default arrow pointer is displayed.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.CURSOR_NA
member.summary: Pointer indicating that an operation is not available is displayed.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.CURSOR_DND
member.summary: Pointer for a drag-and-drop operation is displayed.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.CURSOR_WIDTH
member.summary: Pointer for horizontal resizing is displayed.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.CURSOR_HEIGHT
member.summary: Pointer for vertical resizing is displayed.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.CURSOR_NESW
member.summary: Pointer for top-right / bottom-left resizing is displayed.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.CURSOR_NWSE
member.summary: Pointer for top-left / bottom-right resizing is displayed.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.CURSOR_MOVE
member.summary: Pointer for move operation is displayed.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.CURSOR_ROTATE
member.summary: Pointer for rotation operation is displayed.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.CURSOR_SCALE
member.summary: Pointer for operation of object scaling is displayed.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.NUM_CURSORS
member.summary: Number of cursors.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.VALIDATOR_ANY
member.summary: Input control accepts any data.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.VALIDATOR_INT
member.summary: Input control accepts only integer data.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.VALIDATOR_UINT
member.summary: Input control accepts only unsigned integer data.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.VALIDATOR_FLOAT
member.summary: Input control accepts only floating point data.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.VALIDATOR_ASCII
member.summary: Input control accepts only ASCII based symbols.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.VERTICAL
member.summary: Widget has vertical orientation.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.HORIZONTAL
member.summary: Widget has horizontal orientation.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.MOUSE_MASK_LEFT
member.summary: The bit mask value of the left mouse button.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.MOUSE_MASK_MIDDLE
member.summary: The bit mask value of the middle mouse button.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.MOUSE_MASK_RIGHT
member.summary: The bit mask value of the right mouse button.

member.name: F:Unigine.Gui.MOUSE_MASK_DCLICK
member.summary: The bit mask value of the double click.
